org.digijava.kernel.lucene

Interface LucModule<E>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LucHelpModule, LucOrganisationModule, LucTranslationModule, TrnLuceneModule

    public interface LucModule<E>
extends java.io.Serializable
    Lucene Module interface. Each time we want to index something we have to implement this interface and register implementation with LuceneWorker. Each implementation represents one separate Index in lucene. they should be stored in separate folders. Because of this each module returns its own name which is used as folder names. There are two types of beans that can be indexed: First type is simple one, only one index for them is required and all beans are stored there. Such module implementations may return null as suffix. Examples of such modules could be Organizations - LucOrganisationModule, Indicators and others. When searching such indexes suffix parameters can be null or methods without this parameters can be used. Second type of indexes require same types of beans be split in different indexes by some feature. For example translations should be split in separate indexes by language code. Help module LucHelpModule requires language code + module instance because there are two types of help content, one for user and other for admin and user should not be able to search admin help. For this reason modules of second type should return suffix values other then null to let LuceneWorker distinguish them. For example translatioins return language codes, like en, fr, sp so folders will look like translation_fr.

    • Method Detail

      • getSerialVersionUID

        long getSerialVersionUID()
        Returns value of serialVersionUID static variable of implementing class. NOTE This value should be changed each time the implementation class is changed!!!
        Returns:

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns name of the module. e.g. Translation, Help, Activity
        Returns:
        name of the module.

      • getSuffix

        java.lang.String getSuffix()
        Returns sub directory name where indexes will be stored. usually same as name above but in lower case to not have problems with different FS.
        Returns:
        name of the sub-folder for indexes.

      • getItemClass

        java.lang.Class<E> getItemClass()

      • getAnalyzer

        org.apache.lucene.analysis.Analyzer getAnalyzer()
        Each module should return its own type of analyzer object. This is used to analyze texts for indexing. Usually this is instance of StandardAnalyzer
        Returns:

      • getItemsToIndex

        java.util.List<E> getItemsToIndex()
                           throws DgException
        Returns all items for the module that should be indexed when rebuilding it. Examples can be all organizations, or all contacts.
        Returns:
        list of items of type E
        Throws:
        DgException

      • needIndexRebuild

        boolean needIndexRebuild()
        If for some reason module needs to rebuild indexes then this method will return true.
        Returns:

      • convertToDocument

        org.apache.lucene.document.Document convertToDocument(E item)
        Converts one item to lucene Document. So each module "knows" how to convert their items to lucene document.
        Parameters:
        item -
        Returns:

      • getIdFieldTerm

        org.apache.lucene.index.Term getIdFieldTerm(E item)
        Get term for ID field to search one single doc. Module should create term by using field name as first parameter in term constructor and value of that field retrieved from item as second parameters TODO need refactoring: probably it is better to get ID value from module and build Term object in LuceneWorker?
        Returns:

      • getSearchFieldNames

        java.lang.String[] getSearchFieldNames()

        Returns:

      • luceneDocToItem

        E luceneDocToItem(AmpLuceneDoc luceneDoc)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Converts one hit object to one bean of type E. This method knows how to read field values from hit and build from it object of E class.
        Parameters:
        scoreDoc - lucene search result - one scoreDoc.
        Returns:
        bean of E
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
